section.para: The ngx_http_auth_jwt_module module (1.11.3) implements client authorization by validating the provided JSON Web Token (JWT) using the specified keys. JWT claims must be encoded in a JSON Web Signature (JWS) structure. The module can be used for OpenID Connect authentication.
The module may be combined with other access modules, such as ngx_http_access_module, ngx_http_auth_basic_module, and ngx_http_auth_request_module, via the directive.

para.note: This module is available as part of our commercial subscription.

directive.name: auth_jwt
directive.para: Enables validation of JSON Web Token. The specified string is used as a realm. Parameter value can contain variables.

The optional token parameter specifies a variable that contains JSON Web Token. By default, JWT is passed in the Authorization header as a Bearer Token. JWT may be also passed as a cookie or a part of a query string:
auth_jwt "closed site" token=$cookie_auth_token;
The special value off cancels the effect of the auth_jwt directive inherited from the previous configuration level.

directive.name: auth_jwt_header_set
directive.para: Sets the variable to the given JOSE header parameter name.

directive.name: auth_jwt_claim_set
directive.para: Sets the variable to the given JWT claim parameter name.

directive.name: auth_jwt_key_file
directive.para: Specifies a file in JSON Web Key Set format for validating JWT signature. Parameter value can contain variables.

section.name: Embedded Variables
section.para: The ngx_http_auth_jwt_module module supports embedded variables:

list.tag-desc: returns the value of a specified JOSE header
